title: Create API endpoint to create issues
description: Build a backend endpoint that calls 'bd create' with the provided issue details. Return the created issue ID for adding to the graph.

title: Full Tool Executor Test Issue
description: A test description

title: Test Full Issue
description: Test description

title: Implement git commit on changes
description: After any issue or dependency change, automatically run 'bd sync' to commit the changes to git. Provide feedback to the user about the commit.

title: Create authenticated git operations service
description: Use the GitHub access token to perform git operations (clone, fetch, push) on behalf of the user. Handle token refresh if needed. This replaces direct git CLI calls.

title: Add single command to run all e2e tests
description: Although e2e/load-beads-issues.spec.ts passes, it should be more convenient to run. Add a single command that runs all end-to-end tests. See scripts/dev.ts for inspiration on how to structure this.

title: Clone test repo into temp directory
description: In e2e/load-beads-issues.spec.ts, clone the test repository (bead-feeder-example-issues) into a temporary directory at the start of the test. This gives us direct filesystem access to run beads CLI commands against it.

title: Enable edge creation by connecting nodes
description: Configure React Flow to allow users to draw edges between nodes by dragging from one node's handle to another. This represents creating a dependency relationship.

title: Add repository selector UI
description: After login, show user their GitHub repos that contain .beads directories. Allow them to select which repo to visualize and manage.

title: Extract issues and dependencies data structure from DAG view
description: In the e2e test, after the DAG view loads, extract a data structure from the UI that represents the issues and their dependencies. This should mirror the structure extracted from the beads CLI so they can be compared.

title: Set up React Router v7
description: Install and configure react-router v7 for navigation. Set up basic routes for the main DAG view and any detail views needed.

title: Extract issues and dependencies from cloned repo using beads CLI
description: After cloning the test repo, run beads CLI commands (bd list, bd show, etc.) to extract issue titles and their dependencies. Build a data structure representing the issues and their dependency relationships. Assert that we have some issues and dependencies.

title: Create React Flow canvas component
description: Build the main canvas component using React Flow. Set up the FlowProvider, configure pan/zoom controls, and create the basic layout structure.

title: Create API endpoint to add dependencies
description: Build a backend endpoint that calls 'bd dep add <blocked> <blocker>' when a user connects two nodes. Handle validation to prevent cycles.

title: Add React Flow library and configure
description: Install React Flow (@xyflow/react) and set up basic configuration. Create a wrapper component that will house the DAG visualization.

title: Make 'dev' run both a dev server and dev API server with a single output stream
Pass repository context to graph API
Remove Claude verification from e2e test
description: Remove the section in e2e/load-beads-issues.spec.ts that asks Claude for a final verification of the screenshot. The test should be deterministic and not rely on AI verification.

title: Handle sync conflicts and errors
description: Detect and handle git conflicts (e.g., someone else pushed). Show conflict resolution UI or auto-resolve using bd merge strategies. Retry failed pushes with backoff.

title: Clean up test artifact issues
description: Remove test issues created by tool-executor tests: 'Test Full Issue' and 'Full Tool Executor Test Issue'

title: Implement DAG layout algorithm
description: Implement automatic positioning of nodes in a DAG layout (layered/hierarchical). Issues with no dependencies go at the top/left, and dependent issues are positioned below/right. Consider using dagre or elkjs.

title: Transform dependencies to React Flow edges
description: Create a data transformer that converts beads dependency relationships into React Flow edge format. Each dependency becomes a directed edge from blocker to blocked issue.

title: Create API endpoint to get dependency graph
description: Build a backend endpoint that calls 'bd graph --all --json' or 'bd dep list' to get the dependency relationships between issues. This will be the data source for edges in the graph.

title: Stop creating test issues in the local beads repository
Implement git push to remote
description: Add ability to push committed changes to the GitHub remote. Can be automatic after each commit or triggered by a button. Show push status to user.

title: Define LLM tools for graph manipulation
description: Create tool definitions the LLM can call: create_issue, add_dependency, remove_dependency, update_issue, close_issue. Each tool maps to the corresponding bd CLI command.

title: Create custom node component for issues
description: Build a custom React Flow node component that displays issue details: title, status (with color coding), type, and priority. Make it visually clear and clickable.

title: Configure GitHub OAuth app
description: Register a GitHub OAuth app for the web app. Store client ID and secret in environment variables. Document the required scopes (repo access for reading/writing).

title: Transform issues to React Flow nodes
description: Create a data transformer that converts beads issue data into React Flow node format. Map issue ID to node ID, position nodes, and include issue metadata.

title: Add Playwright script to sign into GitHub and take screenshot
description:
Create a Playwright test script that:

1. Launches a browser
2. Signs into GitHub using TEST_GITHUB_USERNAME and TEST_GITHUB_PASSWORD environment variables
3. Takes a screenshot of the authenticated browser state

This is the foundation for future e2e tests that need to test the real OAuth flow.

Implementation notes:
- Add playwright as a dev dependency
- Add TEST_GITHUB_USERNAME and TEST_GITHUB_PASSWORD to .env.example
- Script should be runnable standalone (e.g., bun run test:e2e:login or similar)
- Store screenshot in a sensible location (e.g., screenshots/ or test-results/)

title: Implement GitHub OAuth login flow
description: Add login button that redirects to GitHub OAuth. Handle the callback, exchange code for access token, and store the token securely (httpOnly cookie or server session).

title: Connect boxes in Dag view for dependent issues
description: In the Dag view, when one issue depends on another, the boxes should be visually connected (e.g., with lines/edges) to show the dependency relationship.

title: Compare CLI and DAG data structures in test assertion
description: The final assertion in the e2e test should compare the data structure extracted from beads CLI with the data structure extracted from the DAG view. They should match. Use this test to fix any failures with the current DAG rendering implementation.

title: Integrate LLM API for chat
description: Connect to an LLM API (e.g., Anthropic Claude) from the backend. Handle streaming responses. Manage conversation history and context.

title: Implement background job queue for sync
description: Create a job queue that processes git sync operations in the background. Queue commits after each graph change, debounce rapid changes, and push periodically or on queue drain.

title: Fix linting warnings in test files
description: The codebase has 16 lint warnings for non-null assertions (!) in test files. These should be replaced with proper null checks or assertions to satisfy the linter. Files affected: src/components/ChatPanel.test.tsx, src/transformers/dagLayout.test.ts

title: Add issue creation UI
description: Create a UI for adding new issues - could be a floating action button that opens a modal/drawer. Include fields for title, description, type, and priority.

title: Add chat UI component
description: Create a chat panel (sidebar or overlay) with message history display, text input, and send button. Support markdown rendering in assistant responses.

title: Create API endpoint to list issues
description: Build a backend endpoint that calls 'bd list --json' and returns all issues in JSON format. This will be the data source for nodes in the graph.

title: Test issue
description: Test description

title: Use sans-serif font in UI
description: Based on the screenshot of the test passing, the UI currently uses Times New Roman or a similar serif font. Update the styling to use a sans-serif font for better readability.

title: Initialize Vite React TypeScript project
description: Set up a new Vite project with React and TypeScript. Configure the project structure with src/ directory for components and services. This is the foundation for the web app.

title: E2E test: Load beads issues from GitHub repository
description:
## Overview
Implement a Playwright end-to-end test that verifies the full flow of signing into GitHub and loading beads issues from a test repository.

## Requirements

### Authentication
- Sign in to GitHub using credentials from environment variables:
  - `TEST_GITHUB_USERNAME`
  - `TEST_GITHUB_PASSWORD`
- Can reuse/extend the existing `e2e/github-login.spec.ts` pattern

### Repository Selection
- Navigate to the app under test
- Select the repository specified in `TEST_GITHUB_REPOSITORY` env var
- Test repository: `josh-beads-test-1/bead-feeder-example-issues` (contains sample beads issues)

### Verification
- Verify that beads issues from the selected repository load and display in the web UI
- Test is considered complete when issues are visibly rendered in the interface

### Error Handling
- On any test failure, capture a screenshot of the browser window
- Log the path to the screenshot in test output for debugging
- Example: `attachment #1: screenshot (image/png) -- test-results/.../test-failed-1.png`

### Constraints
- **Do NOT commit any changes to the test repository** - neither in automated tests nor manual testing
- This is a read-only verification test

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Test authenticates with GitHub successfully
- [ ] Test navigates to app and selects the test repository
- [ ] Test verifies beads issues are displayed in the UI
- [ ] Screenshots are captured and paths logged on failure
- [ ] No writes/commits to the test repository

title: Add debug logging to DAG rendering code
description: Add permanent console.log statements in the code under test (DAG rendering) so it's easy to understand when things break. These should stay in the codebase, not just be temporary debugging aids.

title: Execute LLM tool calls and update graph
description: When the LLM returns tool calls, execute them against bd, update the React Flow graph in real-time, and trigger background sync.

title: Add sync status indicator
description: Show a status indicator in the UI for sync state: synced, syncing, pending changes, error. Use toast notifications for sync completion or failures.
